explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 74degC (open cup flash test) (NFPA (13th, 2002)), which is classified into Category 4.

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2750) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen and chlorine (but not fluorine), with the oxygen and chlorine bound to carbon and hydrogen respectively (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2750) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 81mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 81mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2005)) and 122mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 97-10 (1998)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 500mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data of rabbit LD50 (dermal route) of 500mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 97-10 (1998)) and 590mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2005)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the LC50 (4 hours) value of 32.5ppm, calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (4-hour inhalation of vapour) of 125mL/m3 (DFGOT vol.1 (1990)), was lower that 90% of the saturated vapour concentration (9,000ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 0.9kPa (20degC), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 97-10 (1998) and CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.201 (2004)): "moderate damage" and "irritation" (though recovery period is not presented). The substance is thus considered a skin irritant (though the results are not those of 4-hour application).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 97-10 (1998) and CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.201 (2004)): "strong irritation," "severe irritation" (though recovery period is not presented). The substance is thus considered irritating to the eye (though the results are not those of 4-hour application).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: No data available

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2005), CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.201 (2005) and DFGOT Vol.1 (1991).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible based on expert judgment, in the absence of existing classification except EU risk phrase.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence: "some cases diagnosed as acute fulminant hepatitis" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.201 (2004)).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (liver, kidneys, blood system) Category 2 (respiratory organs)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "histopathological changes in the liver and kidney (multifocal renal tubular degeneration etc.), histopathological changes in the nasal passage (turbinate adhesion, nasal mucosal degeneration, hyperplasia of the respiratory/nasal mucosa), decreased hemoglobin/hematocrit levels, reduced RBC in females, fatty degeneration of hepatocytes" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.201 (2004)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1 (liver, kidneys, blood system) and Category 2 (respiratory organs).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Not classified from 96 hours LC50>100mg/L of the fish (Oryzias Latipest) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals, 1996).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since it was not water-insolubility (the water-solubility =99000mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), and acute toxicity was low, it was classified into Not classified.
